The: 360 billion figure specifically refers to losses from cyber-hacking, but it does not include non-cyber losses. Adding non-cyber losses would likely increase the figure beyond $360 billion.
Intellectual property refers to creative: literary and artistic works, designs, symbols, names, and images used in commerce. It is protected legally through patents, copyrights, and trademarks, but cross-border theft of intellectual property is difficult to police.
China has been identified as one of the: driven by an aggressive technology quest by the Chinese government.
